description: Lists descriptions of all the Amazon Redshift event notification subscriptions for a customer account. If you specify a subscription name, lists the description for that subscription. If you specify both tag keys and tag values in the same request, Amazon Redshift returns all event notification subscriptions that match any combination of the specified keys and values. For example, if you have owner and environment for tag keys, and admin and test for tag values, all subscriptions that have any combination of those values are returned. If both tag keys and values are omitted from the request, subscriptions are returned regardless of whether they have tag keys or values associated with them.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100 Constraints: minimum 20, maximum 100.

parameters.name: TagKeys
parameters.description: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching event notification subscriptions that are associated with the specified key or keys. For example, suppose that you have subscriptions that are tagged with keys called owner and environment. If you specify both of these tag keys in the request, Amazon Redshift returns a response with the subscriptions that have either or both of these tag keys associated with them. (string) ---

parameters.name: TagValues
parameters.description: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching event notification subscriptions that are associated with the specified tag value or values. For example, suppose that you have subscriptions that are tagged with values called admin and test. If you specify both of these tag values in the request, Amazon Redshift returns a response with the subscriptions that have either or both of these tag values associated with them. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: A value that indicates the starting point for the next set of response records in a subsequent request. If a value is returned in a response, you can retrieve the next set of records by providing this returned marker value in the Marker parameter and retrying the command. If the Marker field is empty, all response records have been retrieved for the request.

nested_items.name: CustomerAwsId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: CustSubscriptionId
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: SnsTopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
Can be one of the following: active | no-permission | topic-not-exist.

The status 'no-permission' indicates that Amazon Redshift no longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status 'topic-not-exist' indicates that the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.

nested_items.name: SubscriptionCreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription was created.

nested_items.name: SourceType
nested_items.description: The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.

nested_items.name: SourceIdsList
nested_items.description: A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: EventCategoriesList
nested_items.description: The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled; true indicates that the subscription is enabled.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the event subscription.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the resource tag.
